column3: @laanwj Alright, should be complete and I removed all `()` like you suggested.\nAn additional idea now would be to send all these to our debug window, what do you think?\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/42018eff07d235930ca91fa9e76e7ac128183438 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

I don't think it is useful to send all the logging to the debug window, I've thought about that in the beginning but we simply log so much for that it would bog down the GUI and it would not be useful either. At least with the current console widget. I guess it'd be possible to add a tab "logging" with a hyper-optimized scrolling widget, but I doubt it's worth the trouble and extra code.\n

I wonder why you add `()` to the function names? In case of overloaded functions I guess it could make sense to add the argument types to the signature, but an empty `()` seems unnecessary.

Edit: btw you can use `__func__` to get the current function name
